contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "fathers" is a synecdoche for all ancestors. Alternate translation: "ancestors" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: fathers

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "face" is a metonym for the whole person. "You will not" is a command. "Do not be afraid of anyone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: You will not be afraid of the face of man

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the people are represented by their "eyes" to emphasize what they saw. Alternate translation: "which you yourselves saw" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: before your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: The "work of your hand" refers to all the work they had done. Alternate translation: "all of your work" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: you in all the work of your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "the hand of Yahweh" refers to Yahweh's power. Alternate translation: "Yahweh used his power against" or "Yahweh punished" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the hand of Yahweh was against

contextId.occurrenceNote: Moses is referring to the people of Israel as if they were Moses himself. Alternate translation: "sell to me and my people ... we may eat ... give us ... we may drink" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: sell me ... I may eat ... give me ... I may drink

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "him" is a metonym for "his people." Alternate translation: "You will destroy Og and his people as you did Sihon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: You will do to him as you did to Sihon

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" refers to Joshua. Alternate translation: "You have seen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Your eyes have seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" refers to the people of Israel. Alternate translation: "You saw" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Your eyes have seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" are a synecdoche for the person. Alternate translation: "you have seen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: your eyes have seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "men's hands" refers the men themselves, and "the work ... wood and stone" to the idols that they have created. Alternate translation: "the wood and stone idols that men have made" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the work of men's hands, wood and stone

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here God is represented by his voice. Alternate translation: "hear God's voice as he spoke" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: hear the voice of God speaking

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" refer to the whole person. Alternate translation: "in front of you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: before your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "ears" refers to the whole person. This metaphor emphasizes that the people know what Moses has said to them, so they cannot sin and then say they did not know they were sinning. Alternate translation: "that I will speak to you today" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: that I will speak in your ears today

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" is a reference to the city itself. Alternate translation: "within your community" or "inside your city" or "living with you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within your gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "voice" is a metonym for the sound of the voice or for the person who was speaking. Alternate translation: "heard the sound of the voice" or "heard Yahweh speaking" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: heard the voice

contextId.occurrenceNote: This represents all people or living things. Alternate translation: "all people" or "all living beings" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: all flesh

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "eyes" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "where we could see them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: before our eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" represent the whole person. Alternate translation: "that you saw" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: that your eyes saw

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "bread" represents all food. Alternate translation: "food is not the only thing people need so they can live" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: it is not by bread alone that people live

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "your eyes" is a synecdoche for the people of Israel. Alternate translation: "I broke them right in front of you" or "I broke them where you could see them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: I broke them before your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "which you yourselves have seen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: which your eyes have seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "But you have seen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: But your eyes have seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "the sole of your foot" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "Every place you go" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Every place where the sole of your foot will tread

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "the offerings that you present" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the offerings presented by your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "put your hand to" represents the whole person and work that he has done. Alternate translation: "rejoice about all the work you have done" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: rejoice about everything that you have put your hand to

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "the offerings that you present" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the offerings presented by your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" is a reference to the city itself. Alternate translation: "the Levites who live inside your city" or "the Levites living with you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the Levites who are within your gate

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" represents the whole city. Alternate translation: "inside your city" or "at your homes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within all your gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" represents the whole city. Alternate translation: "inside your city" or "at your homes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within your gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "nor that of any offering which you bring to Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: nor that of the offering you present with your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gate" represents the whole city Alternate translation: "any Levite who lives inside your city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the Levite who is within your gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "put your hand to" represents the whole person and work that he has done. Alternate translation: "rejoice about all the work you have done" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: everything to which you put your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "soul" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "as you want" or "as you crave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: as your soul desires

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" represents the whole city." Alternate translation: "inside your city" or "within your community" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within your gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "soul" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "as you desire" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: as your soul desires

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "children" means all of their descendants. Alternate translation: "that you and your descendants may prosper" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: that it may go well with you and with your children after you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "your eye" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "you msut not look at him with pity" or "you must not show him mercy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: you must not permit your eye to pity him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that he was to throw the first stone at the guilty person. The word "hand" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "you must be the first to strike him to kill him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: your hand will be the first on him to put him to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "the other people will join you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the hand of all the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "edge" represents the whole sword. Alternate translation: "with your swords" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: with the edge of the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" represents the entire city or town. Alternate translation: "inside your city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within your gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" represents the whole person. This refers to the work that someone does. Alternate translation: "in all the work you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: in all the work of your hand that you do

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" represents the entire city or town. Alternate translation: "within any of your towns" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within any of your gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "heart" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "you should not regret it" or "you should be happy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.glQuote: your heart must not be sorry

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "put your hand to" represents the whole person and work that he has done. Alternate translation: "in all that you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: in all that you put your hand to

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" represents the city or town. Alternate translation: "within your community" or "inside your city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within your gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" represents the cities or towns. Alternate translation: "within any of your towns" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within any of your city gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "and you will give your free will offering" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: with the contribution of a freewill offering from your hand that you will give

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" represents cities or towns. Alternate translation: "within your towns" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within your city gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "gates" represents cities or towns. Alternate translation: "within your towns" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within your gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hands" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "all the work you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: all the work of your hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" represents a city or town. Alternate translation: "within all your towns" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within all your city gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "city gates" represents cities or towns. Alternate translation: "living in one of your cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within any of your city gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" represents the entire group of witnesses. Alternate translation: "The witnesses themselves must be the first ones to throw stones. Then all the people will execute the person by throwing stones at him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: The hand of the witnesses must be the first to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "heart" refers to the whole person. An Israelite king who marries foreign wives and starts to worship their false gods is spoken of as if his heart were to turn away from Yahweh. Alternate translation: "so that they do not cause him to stop honoring Yahweh and start worshiping false gods" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: so that his heart does not turn away

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "his heart" refers to the whole person. A king becoming arrogant is spoken of as if his heart were lifted up. Alternate translation: "so that he does not become arrogant" or "so that he does not think he is better than his fellow Israelites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: so that his heart is not lifted up above his brothers

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "him" represents all the Levites. Alternate translation: "the Levites and their descendants forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: him and his sons forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Yahweh is represented by his "voice" to emphasize what he says. Alternate translation: "Let us not hear Yahweh our God speak again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Let us not hear again the voice of Yahweh our God

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "your eye" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "Do not show him mercy" or "Do not feel sorry for him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Your eye must not pity him

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" refer to the whole person. Alternate translation: "You must not pity him" or "You must not show him mercy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Your eyes must not pity

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hands" are a synecdoche for the whole person and "shed this blood" is a metonym for killing an innocent person. Alternate translation: "We did not kill this innocent person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: Our hands have not shed this blood

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "and we did not see anyone kill this person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: neither have our eyes seen it

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the "eyes" represent the whole person. Alternate translation: "if he decides that he does not like her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: if she finds no favor in his eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "city gates" mean towns or cities. Alternate translation: "in one of your cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within your city gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hands" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "in all the work that you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: in all the work of your hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the people are represented by their "eyes" to emphasize what they see. Alternate translation: "humiliated, and you would all see it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: humiliated before your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eye" means the whole person. Alternate translation: "you should not feel sorry for her" or "you must not show her mercy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: your eye must have no pity

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "gates" means towns or cities. Alternate translation: "so that those within your towns may have enough food to eat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: eat within your city gates and be filled

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "hand" is a synecdoche for the whole person. Alternate translation: "all the work that you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: all the work of your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "your eyes" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "you will grow tired as you constantly watch for them and long to see them again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: your eyes will look for them the entire day, but will fail with longing for them

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the phrase "city gates" represents a city. Alternate translation: "your cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: you in all your city gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "city gates" represents the cities themselves. Alternate translation: "all your cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: all your city gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "city gates" represents the cities themselves. Alternate translation: "within your cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: within your city gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the phrase "the bottoms of your feet" refer to the whole person. Alternate translation: "you will have to continually wander because you have no permanent home where you can rest" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: there will be no rest for the bottoms of your feet

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "the terrifying things I will force you to see" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the things your eyes will have to see

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh expected them to remember what Yahweh had done and they had seen it. Here the "eyes" represent the whole person and emphasize what the person has seen. Alternate translation: "You have seen all that Yahweh did so that you would see and remember what he did" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: You have seen everything that Yahweh did before your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "eyes" emphasizes that Yahweh expected them to remember that they had seen it. Alternate translation: "you saw for yourselves that the people suffered terribly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the great sufferings that your eyes saw

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "heart" refers to the whole person, and "turning away" means to stop obeying. Alternate translation: "who no longer obeys Yahweh our God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: whose heart is turning away today from Yahweh our God

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "in all the work you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the work of your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "heart" refers to the whole person. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if you stop being loyal to God ... and the people living in the land convince you to bow down and worship other gods" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if your heart turns away ... but instead are drawn away and bow down to other gods and worship them

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "Sihon" and "Og" refer to two Kings of the Amorites and their armies. See how you translated these names in [Deuteronomy 1:4](../01/04.md). Alternate translation: "he did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their armies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: he did to Sihon and to Og, the kings of the Amorites

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "city gates" represents the cities themselves. Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the instances of "your" here are singular. Alternate translation: "your foreigners who live in your cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-you]])
contextId.glQuote: your foreigner who is within your city gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "in their ears" means the people themselves. Alternate translation: "so that I may speak the words of this song to them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: so that I may speak these words in their ears

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "your hands" means the people themselves. Alternate translation: "because of what you have made" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: through the work of your hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "ears" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "Moses recited to all the people of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Moses recited in the ears of all the assembly of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The teeth and the poison are synecdoches for the animals that use these things to kill. Alternate translation: "I will send wild animals to bite them, and things that crawl in the dust to bite and poison them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: I will send on them the teeth of wild animals, with the poison of things that crawl in the dust

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hand" represents the whole person. Alternate translation: "when I get ready to judge the wicked" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: when my hand begins to bring justice

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "ears" represents the people themselves and emphasizes that Moses wanted to make sure they heard the song clearly. Alternate translation: "to the people so they would be sure to hear it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: in the ears of the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "hands" refers to the whole person. Alternate translation: "all the work that he does" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the work of his hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "head" and "top of the head" represent the whole person. Also, Joseph represents his descendants. Alternate translation: "be upon the descendants of Joseph" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: come on the head of Joseph, and on the top of the head of him
